main event: A teacher observed a bright yellow spherical object in the sky over San Francisco, California, on the night of November 29, 1948.
interesting points: The object changed course from due north to north-northwest., The sighting lasted for approximately 7 seconds., The observer used binoculars and noted the object's steady glow and absence of a trail., Despite attempts to trace the object's course, no additional witnesses were identified., The object was determined to be too fast for a conventional plane.
witness description: A science teacher at Francisco Junior High School with above-average intelligence, reliable, and binoculars were used during the observation.
